snippet: The nations on Wednesday discussed migration, and a meeting on Thursday will cover matters like reopening embassies.
abstract: Cuban and American officials meet in Havana to discuss details of restored diplomatic ties between nations; countries disagree on policy that allows Cubans who reach American soil to qualify for residency after one year, with Cuban officials expressing concern that policy encourages Cuban immigrants to undertake dangerous sea journeys to United States; American officials say that policy will remain in place.
lead_paragraph: The nations on Wednesday discussed migration, and a meeting on Thursday will cover matters like reopening embassies.

headline.main: U.S. and Cuba Set to Discuss Diplomatic Ties
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Cuba Set to Discuss Diplomatic Ties
